subject: testing code that inserts into a database
msgSnippet: I am writing (and testing) code that selects and inserts through JDBC to a relational database. I followed the guidelines for writing test cases from this
messageBody:
I am writing (and testing) code that selects and inserts through JDBC to a relational database.
 
I followed the guidelines for writing test cases from this article:
http://www.dallaway.com/acad/dbunit.html
 
For code that reads from the database, I have a separate class that has methods to insert all my test data into the database and delete it all. It also exposes the ids for all rows that are inserted into the database for use in my test cases. My test classes extend TestCase and call this code in the setUp() and tearDown() methods before and after each test is run.
 
My question is on how to test code that inserts into the database. I am concerned about inserting data into the database that may later interfere with my tests that read from the database so I want to make sure that all data is removed from the database after the insert methods are tested. Should this code be in the test method? Also, what is the best way to verify that everything was inserted correctly?
 
Thanks for any responses.
